headline: Palo Alto Networks target adjusted for stock split at Scotiabank
summary: Scotiabank lowered the firm’s price target on Palo Alto Networks (PANW) to $200 from $400 and keeps an Outperform rating on the shares following the company’s 2-for-1 share split. The firm still sees the company as one of the best long-term stories in software, benefiting from a “sticky” core business, vendor consolidation, and adoption of cloud security. Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving breaking financial news. Try Now>> See the top stocks recommended

headline: SentinelOne: Focus On AI And Automation Is A Key Differentiator
summary: SentinelOne's fundamentals show steady progress with positive EBITDA and UCFC margins on the horizon. See why we are neutral on S stock.
